revised_title: Observations of a Unique Aurora Borealis Event in Streatham, Surrey
tldr: In 1717, Mr. Thomas Hearne and Coll. Francis Nicholson observed a unique Aurora Borealis event in Streatham, Surrey. The event featured a canopy-like formation of light streams meeting near the zenith, a different color and intensity compared to previous observations. The authors noted the calm and serene atmosphere and the presence of lucid clouds.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Meteorology and Atmospheric Sciences
